speaker: Anvil Trial
lines: You draw heat and lose nerve; you draw nerve and lose heat. This is how it goes.
The bar's red fades to orange while the hammer learns your wrist.
A bevel appears because you ask politely.
Scale flakes like black snow and tells you not to rush.
A straight thing bends until you convince it, then pretends it chose to.
The anvil gives back exactly what you give it, except heavier.
You can stop now and call it a lesson.
Or you can hit once more and call it yours.

choices.text: Drop it and pick a fight with your impatience.
